newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Sipa says too early to dismiss Mt Olympus.
newsitem.headline: Sipa says too early to dismiss Mt Olympus.

text.p: Gold explorer Sipa Resources International NL said on Wednesday that it was too early to say that all deposits in the Ashburton region of Western Australia would be refractory, and therefore difficult to mine economically.

Shares in the company fell sharply last Friday when it said metallurgical work on sulphide mineralisation from the Mount Olympus prospect had shown that there was not an economic refractory ore treatment process available.
Contained gold that was refractory was not amenable to recovery by the conventional cyanidation process, it said at the time.

"The Mount Olympus deposit shows that the Ashburton region is capable of hosting large gold deposits," the company said in Wednesday's statement, citing concern about the sharp fall inits share price.
